assemblage.title: Extraction of Roots
assemblage.p:
To solve the equation a(px+q)^2 +r=0
Isolate the squared expression, (px + q)^2.
Take the square root of each side of the equation. Remember that a positive number has two square roots.
Solve each equation. There are two solutions.

assemblage.title: Compound Interest
assemblage.p: If interest is compounded annually for n years, the amount, A, of money in an account is given by A = P(1 + r)^n where P is the principal and r is the interest rate, expressed as a decimal fraction.

li.p: We can give exact answers to a simple nonlinear equation, or we can give decimal approximations.
Simple nonlinear equations can be solved by undoing the operations on the variable.
How many square roots does a positive number have?
